page.title: 04OLD TORRY
page.content: Torry lost part of its heritage when 3.5 acres of OLD TORRY was razed to make way for oil developments. Gone are the "barking" sheds where endless yards of rope were weather- proofed.Vanished also are the "yawls" which could be seen lying on this south bank of the River Dee. The cooperages which once enjoyed untold prosperity at the turn of the century when Aberdeen exported 1,000,0000 barrels of herring a year to Russia alone have also disappeared. All that does remain today as a clue to where OLD TORRY once stood is a small white lighthouse known as the "Leading Lighthouse" on Sinclair Road,adjacent to the Shell Oil Base. Also still existing today are a generation of memories of those who had lived in the tiny cottages, but will these memories remain forever?
